avalancheActivity.highlights: Significant amount of snow has been added in mountains and the snowpack can be unstable in all aspects. People traveling on steep terrain should be careful and choose conservative routes.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Significant amount of snow was added in mountains in rather calm wind the 26th of Dec. Prior to that windslabs were formed in southerly aspects after strong NE and then NW winds, mainly in lows and gullies. Older windslabs may also still exist in easterly aspects. No snow profiles have been done in the area to check the stability of the snowpack but windslabs may be unstable and the boundary between the new snow and older windslabs might be weak. Large natural avalanches are considered unlikely in these conditions, but people travelling in steep terrain might trigger avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: Winter conditions and new or recent snow in most parts. Widely there is loose new snow that can easely drift. Widely there are older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. People traveling on steep terrain should be careful and choose conservative routes. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, the snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected as the day goes on.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Winter conditions, widely older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg breytileg eða austlæg átt og lítilsháttar snjókoma eða él næstu daga. Kólnar í veðri

avalancheActivity.comment: Many avalanches have fallen in the area during the weekend, such as in Skutulfjörður, Flateyri, Súðavíkurhlíð and Súgandafjörður.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs in south facing aspects after N and NE snowstorm that can be unstable. Persistent weakness may be widespread.  People traveling on steep terrain should be careful and choose conservative routes.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Much loose snow has been added the last days, especially late 23.12. and early 24.12. Before there was little snow. New windslabs are expected to have formed mainly in southern aspects. A snow profile was done in Seljalandsdalur on the 25th of December at 330 m.asl. The profile shows a weak layer at 63 cm depth with faceted crystals, that are rounding, between an older softer layer and a layer of layered ice lenses. On top there are layered windslabs. Compression test gave a sudden planar break under medium stress (CT13, CT12 @63 SP) at the upper layerboundary of the faceted layer. This weakness may be widespread.

travelAdvisory.comment: Winter conditions and new or recent snow in most parts. Widely there is loose new snow that can easely drift. Widely there are older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. People traveling on steep terrain should be careful and choose conservative routes. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, the snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected as the day goes on.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Winter conditions, widely older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA-A áttir og frost, bætir í snjó á laugardag

avalancheActivity.comment: Multiple avalanches released around Ólafsfjörður and above Ólafsfjarðarvegur on the 24th and 25th. An avalanche released in Strengsgil the night before 24.12. and ran over the road Fjarðarvegur. Two avalanches ran over Siglufjarðarvegur late 23.12.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Significant amount of snow has been added in mountains and the snowpack can be unstable in all aspects. People traveling on steep terrain should be careful and choose conservative routes.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of new snow was added 23.12 and 24.12 and before there was considerable recent snow. It has drifted in variable winds and unstable wind slabs can exist in most aspects, especially south and west facing. The new snow that fell on Wednesday can also be unstable at first. Cold temperatures are expected the next few days and that stimulates the growth of weak layers with facets. Large natural avalanches are considered unlikely in these conditions, but people travelling in steep terrain might break weak layers and trigger avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: Winter conditions and new or recent snow in most parts. Widely there is loose new snow that can easely drift. Widely there are older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. People traveling on steep terrain should be careful and choose conservative routes. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, the snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected as the day goes on.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Winter conditions, widely older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Lítilsháttar él og hægar NA- og A-áttir. Mikið frost, kaldara en hefur verið.

avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of recent snow lies on top of old hardpacked snow. On the intersection can be weaknesses which should grow further in cold temperatures the next days.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Before Christmas, thaw reached mountain tops and when it got cold again, snow got stiff and gained strength. Since then, much snow has been added and transported by winds from most directions. In mountains, wind slabs may exist in all aspects. At lower elevations, snow is widely still loose and light and has not drifted much. Weaknesses should be expected between the recent snow and the underlying hardpacked snow. Cold temperatures the next days can further stimulate the growth of facets and weak layers. Large natural avalanches are considered unlikely in these conditions, but people travelling in steep terrain might break the weak layer and trigger avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: Winter conditions and new or recent snow in most parts. Widely there is loose new snow that can easely drift. Widely there are older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. People traveling on steep terrain should be careful and choose conservative routes. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, the snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected as the day goes on.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Winter conditions, widely older windslabs and possible persistent weak layers in multiple aspects. Becoming warmer on Monday with precipitation, snow can get unstable and wet snow problem expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Lítilsháttar él, N og NV áttir, hægari þegar líður að helgi. Mikið frost.
